publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2335 Mr Gil Paterson: 16 Days Campaign-That the Parliament congratulates the campaigners who are organising events to mark the 16 Days Campaign, which aims to highlight through a variety of initiatives the continuing threat of domestic violence which women face in Scotland and the wider world today; urges MSPs to support the march planned in Edinburgh to highlight this, and calls on the Scottish Executive to join campaigners across Scotland and the rest of the world in celebrating 25 November 2001 as the International Day Against Violence Against Women.
S1M-2335 16 Days Campaign (lodged on 19 October 2001) Michael Matheson*
S1M-2335 16 Days Campaign (lodged on 19 October 2001) Michael Russell*, Fiona McLeod*
S1M-2335 16 Days Campaign (lodged on 19 October 2001) Donald Gorrie*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-2335 16 Days Campaign (lodged on 19 October 2001) Alex Neil*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-2335 16 Days Campaign (lodged on 19 October 2001) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Shona Robison*
S1M-2335 16 Days Campaign (lodged on 19 October 2001) Linda Fabiani*
S1M-2335 16 Days Campaign (lodged on 19 October 2001) Irene McGugan*, Bruce Crawford*
S1M-2335 16 Days Campaign (lodged on 19 October 2001) Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-2335 16 Days Campaign (lodged on 19 October 2001) Dennis Canavan*, Irene Oldfather*
S1M-2335 16 Days Campaign (lodged on 19 October 2001) Cathy Peattie*
S1M-2335 16 Days Campaign (lodged on 19 October 2001) Tricia Marwick*
